channel.title: Everyone even partially interested in Ruby should read this
channel.description:
http://www.amazon.co.uk/Eloquent-Ruby-Addison-Wesley-Professional/dp/0321584104
It should really be called "wtf are those rubyfags so happy about". It explains what is different about Ruby (at least, from the c-likes) and how people use it. If you are learning the language and want to go past picking up syntax to picking up idioms and the "ruby way", it is a very good book. And it's small and pretty light reading.
</fanboyism> (Don't hurt me some people have been interested in Ruby lately :()

item.title: Everyone even partially interested in Ruby should read this
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

amazon.co.uk

Eloquent Ruby (Addison-Wesley Professional Ruby)

It’s easy to write correct Ruby code, but to gain the fluency needed to write great Ruby code, you must go beyond syntax and absorb the “Ruby way” of thinking and problem solving. In Eloquent Ruby, Ru ...

4.5 out of 5 stars, ISBN: 978-0321584106, Addison-Wesley Professional, 11 Feb 2011, £30.99

It should really be called “wtf are those rubyfags so happy about”. It explains what is different about Ruby (at least, from the c-likes) and how people use it. If you are learning the language and want to go past picking up syntax to picking up idioms and the “ruby way”, it is a very good book. And it’s small and pretty light reading.

(Don’t hurt me some people have been interested in Ruby lately :()

Read full topic
